conclusion: Conductor rod ab has length 4L, rotates with angular velocity ω around point O, point a is very close to O (distance ≈ 0), uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the plane, need to find potential difference U_{ab}.

This problem involves electromagnetic induction. When a conductor moves through a magnetic field, an EMF (electromotive force) is induced due to the Lorentz force acting on the free charges in the conductor.
Divide the rod into differential elements and calculate the EMF contribution from each element.
Set up the coordinate system: denote the distance from point O along the rod as x. The rod extends from x ≈ 0 (point a) to x = 4L (point b).

premise: For a point at distance x from O, the linear velocity is v(x) = ω ⋅ x.
conclusion: The linear velocity at each point is v(x) = ω ⋅ x.

premise: For a differential element dx at position x, the induced EMF is dU = Bv(x)dx = Bωx dx.
conclusion: The EMF contribution from each element is dU = Bωx dx.

premise: The total potential difference U_{ab} is the integral of all contributions along the rod: U_{ab} = ∫_{0}^{4L} Bωx dx.
conclusion: Set up the integral for total potential difference: U_{ab} = ∫_{0}^{4L} Bωx dx.
Simplify the integral: U_{ab} = Bω ∫_{0}^{4L} x dx.
Calculate the definite integral: U_{ab} = Bω ((4L)^2/2 - 0^2/2).
The potential difference between points a and b is U_{ab} = 8Bω L^2.
